author: extoci
message: docs: fix grammatical error in upgrading to v15 guide (#81038) Title is pretty self descriptive. Removes the word "you" for better grammatical clarity. Co-authored-by: Joseph

files.patch:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ npm i next@latest react@latest react-dom@latest eslint-config-next@latest
 
 > **Good to know:**
 >
-> - If you see a peer dependencies warning, you may need to update `react` and `react-dom` to the suggested versions, or you use the `--force` or `--legacy-peer-deps` flag to ignore the warning. This won't be necessary once both Next.js 15 and React 19 are stable.
+> - If you see a peer dependencies warning, you may need to update `react` and `react-dom` to the suggested versions, or use the `--force` or `--legacy-peer-deps` flag to ignore the warning. This won't be necessary once both Next.js 15 and React 19 are stable.
 
 ## React 19
